subject: Re: [junit] Is it really neccessery to use Junit with some kind of IDE ?
msgSnippet: ... I like your view of the world, but it is at odd with the one I live and work in. We have developers write code with no tests. They rarely run what tests
messageBody:
On 12/8/05, Yagiz Erkan <yagizerkan@...> wrote:
> Simon,
>
> The build machines that you talk about, in a continuous integration
> environment or not, pull the code to build from the source control system.
> Therefore, the developers need to check in the code before a build can
> happen. And a developer checks in the code only if all the tests succesfully
> completes. Therefore, if you cannot or you don't run all your unit tests on
> your workstation, you cannot check in the code that you're working on.

I like your view of the world, but it is at odd with the one I live
and work in. We have developers write code with no tests. They rarely
run what tests they do have before they check in, so I suggest that
having Cruise Control run the full test suites, on everything all the
time, is vital.

Simon

--
www.simonpeter.com
uab.blogspot.com
